segment.source: You can use the following Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer parameters to sequence an application and to upgrade an existing virtual application by using a command line.
segment.target: You can use the following Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer parameters to sequence an application and to upgrade an existing virtual application by using a command line.

segment.source: For more information about sequencing an application by using a command line, see How to Sequence a New Application by Using the Command Line.
segment.target: For more information about sequencing an application by using a command line, see How to Sequence a New Application by Using the Command Line.

segment.source: Displays information about parameters that are available for using a command line to sequence applications.
segment.target: Displays information about parameters that are available for using a command line to sequence applications.

segment.source: Specifies the Windows Installer or a batch file that will be used to install an application so that it can be sequenced.
segment.target: Specifies the Windows Installer or a batch file that will be used to install an application so that it can be sequenced.

segment.source: Specifies the package root directory for an application.
segment.target: Specifies the package root directory for an application.

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be generated.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be generated.

segment.source: Specifies whether all files will be contained in the primary feature block.
segment.target: Specifies whether all files will be contained in the primary feature block.

segment.source: If the /FULLLOAD parameter is specified on the command line, all of the associated application data is added to primary feature block.
segment.target: If the /FULLLOAD parameter is specified on the command line, all of the associated application data is added to primary feature block.

segment.source: If the /FULLLOAD parameter is not specified on the command line, then none of the associated application data is added to the primary feature block.
segment.target: If the /FULLLOAD parameter is not specified on the command line, then none of the associated application data is added to the primary feature block.

segment.source: Specifies the package name that will be assigned to the sequenced application.
segment.target: Specifies the package name that will be assigned to the sequenced application.

segment.source: Specifies the SFT file block size that will be used to stream the package to client computers.
segment.target: Specifies the SFT file block size that will be used to stream the package to client computers.

segment.source: You can select one of the following values:
segment.target: You can select one of the following values:

segment.source: You should consider the size of the SFT file when you specify the block size.
segment.target: You should consider the size of the SFT file when you specify the block size.

segment.source: A file with a smaller block size takes longer to stream over the network but is less bandwidth-intensive.
segment.target: A file with a smaller block size takes longer to stream over the network but is less bandwidth-intensive.

segment.source: Files with larger block sizes use more network bandwidth.
segment.target: Files with larger block sizes use more network bandwidth.

segment.source: Specifies the method for compressing the SFT file that will be streamed to the client.
segment.target: Specifies the method for compressing the SFT file that will be streamed to the client.

segment.source: Specifies whether a Windows Installer for the sequenced application should be created.
segment.target: Specifies whether a Windows Installer for the sequenced application should be created.

segment.source: Specifies the default SPRJ file that will be used when creating a virtual application package.
segment.target: Specifies the default SPRJ file that will be used when creating a virtual application package.

segment.source: This file is used as the .sprj template when the application is sequenced for the first time.
segment.target: This file is used as the .sprj template when the application is sequenced for the first time.

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be upgraded.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be upgraded.

segment.source: Specifies the directory on the sequencing computer where the files associated with the sequenced application package are installed.
segment.target: Specifies the directory on the sequencing computer where the files associated with the sequenced application package are installed.

segment.source: Use one of the following formats when specifying the directory:
segment.target: Use one of the following formats when specifying the directory:
